name: content
title: Annual Kony Mobile Survey of Fortune 500 companies reveals plans to invest in mobile offerings.

und.safe_value:
Working with Vanson Bourne who conducted the research, Kony announced the results of a recent survey that explored UK consumer and retailer attitudes towards mobile shopping and the impact that mobile is having on traditional shopping methods.

Highlights: The study revealed that UK retailers are unprepared for the imminent consumer demand for mobile commerce, with key findings of the research including:

  • 42 percent of retailers believe that mobile commerce is already affecting shopping behaviour at bricks and mortar stores
  • However, just 16 percent of retailers claim to have a mobile strategy fully in place, and almost a third have no plans to implement one at all
  • Mobile applications and mobile web are the most important elements of retailers’ mobile strategies
  • 60 percent of consumers claim to use mobile internet to make decisions in a store or while shopping online
  • Consumers are open to the idea of NFC payments, and 57 percent of retailers are considering the technology as part of their mobile offering
und.value:

Highlights: The study revealed that UK retailers are unprepared for the imminent consumer demand for mobile commerce, with key findings of the research including:

  • 42 percent of retailers believe that mobile commerce is already affecting shopping behaviour at bricks and mortar stores
  • However, just 16 percent of retailers claim to have a mobile strategy fully in place, and almost a third have no plans to implement one at all
  • Mobile applications and mobile web are the most important elements of retailers’ mobile strategies
  • 60 percent of consumers claim to use mobile internet to make decisions in a store or while shopping online
  • Consumers are open to the idea of NFC payments, and 57 percent of retailers are considering the technology as part of their mobile offering

name: content
title: New Study Shows Retailers are Unprepared for Imminent Consumer Demand for Mobile Commerce
